about_the_game:
Leaving Eden masterfully blends the charm of classic pixel gaming with contemporary HD visuals and mechanics, creating a harmonious fusion of past and present.

You play as The Banished Priest, in search for your beloved daughter. You must contend with the many terrors the night may bring as you venture into cursed lands brimming with occult horrors, disfigurement, death and unruly terror. No saint may rest their feet here.




Telegraph Based Spell System
Wreak havoc using your elemental based spells. Magic is telegraphed, allowing easy to aim spell casting.


Magic!
Conjure mystical spells to sow havoc or mend your injuries. But tread cautiously; your adversaries can also command formidable spells.


Action Based Combat
Step into an immersive 3D environment and engage in combat using 8-directional 2D sprite-based movements.


Keep your wits about you and clash swords, dash and cast spells with your foes in real-time combat.


Monsters!
Terrible creatures and monsters inhabit this world. All with their own unique behaviours and abilities. Some are weak against certain elements and strong against others.


Crafting and Survival
At a camp fire, cook a meal that fills your belly with buffs or create a concoction of ingredients found in the world, or replenish your various potions and craft items to ease your journey.



Rich HD-2D World
A mix between traditional 2D pixel sprites and 3D rendered environments, brings this HD-2D world to life.


Modern Dynamic Lighting and VFX
Taking full advantage of Unreal Engine 5, Leaving Eden offers advanced lighting and VFX, creating a unique stylised aesthetic.


Setting
Taking inspiration from the dark ages of medieval times, Leaving Eden is set in a fictional gothic world. Players must set out with their trusty lantern to illuminate the night, exposing what lurks in the dark.
